content: the airy blouse by dragonfruitknit yarn 50g midara silk mohair 214 gauge 14st by 23 row difficulty ★☆☆☆☆ construction top down raglan size small medium large bust measurements 85 95 105 cm garment circumference 94 104 114 cm materials ● 5 5 mm circular needles 40 cm and 80 cm ● 50g silk mohair yarn ● scissors ● tapestry needle yoke on 5 5 mm 40 cm needles cast on 98 sts for all sizes using the long tail cast on method and place marker for the beginning of the round rounds 1-4 knit round 5 set up round **k31 pm k2 pm k14 pm k2 pm** repeat once use a distinct stitch marker for the beginning of the round round 6 **m1l k until stm m1r k2 ** repeat until end of round round 7 knit repeat round 6 and round 7 alternating between one round of increasing and one round of only knitting 17 20 24 times the amount of st between markers should be 65 48 65 48 71 54 71 54 79 62 79 62 swap stitches to 5 5mm 80 cm needles when stitches get too bunched up on 40 cm needles body place stitches for the sleeves on hold by **k65 71 79 rm k2 rm place 48 54 62 sts onto scrap yarn** repeat once until both sleeves are on hold and only sts for the body including the 8 raglan sts are on the needles continue only knitting until length from beneath the sleeve to the bottom of the garment measures 26 cm cast off using an i-cord bind off optional decrease for a slightly more fitted look as seen in pictures follow the instructions below after garment measures 17cm from underarm **k2tog k65 71 79 pm k2tog k to end of round** repeat every 3-4 cm until the garment measures 26 cm sleeves place 48 54 62 sts back on needles from scrap yarn pick up 7 8 9 st from the underarm and place the beginning of the round marker in the middle of the picked up sts rounds 1-3 knit cast off using an i-cord bind off repeat sleeve instructions for the second sleeve neckline add i-cord edge to neckline stitches for a sleek look abbreviations stitch st remove marker rm knit k increase 1st leaning left m1l stitch marker stm increase 1st leaning right m1r place marker pm notes ● when weaving in the ends i tried to weave mostly into the wrong side edge of the i-cord bind off because the light fabric makes it very easy to see woven in yarn ● for styling purposes i like to wear this blouse on top of tank tops or dresses as a fun pop of color ● i imagine the airy blouse would look really nice with full sleeves so don t feel pressure to make the sleeves short and puffy as i did ● i chose not to block my finished garment because i was happy with
